home.title: Feedback tool for math teachers
home.subtitle: Manage courses, tests, and student feedback

course.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete?
course.deleteConfirmFull: Are you sure you want to delete this course? This will delete all students, tests, and feedback within it.
course.autoSaveEnabled: Auto-save enabled! All completed feedback will be automatically saved to the selected folder.
course.autoSaveEnabledDesc: Completed feedback is automatically saved to your selected folder
course.autoSaveDisabledDesc: Enable auto-save to automatically save completed feedback to a local folder
course.folderStorageConnectedDesc: Connected to "{folder}" — all data is saved and synced automatically
course.folderStorageDisconnectedDesc: Connect a folder (e.g. OneDrive) to store all data there. Works across devices.
course.folderConnected: Folder connected! All existing data has been copied to the folder. Changes will sync automatically.
course.folderDisconnectConfirm: Are you sure you want to disconnect from the folder? Data will remain in the folder, but changes will no longer sync.
course.folderNudgeTitle: Connect a folder for safe storage
course.folderNudgeDesc: Your data is only saved in this browser. Connect a folder (e.g. OneDrive) so your grades survive across browsers, ports, and devices.
course.twoPart: Two-part test (Part 1: no aids, Part 2: all aids)
course.restartNumbering: Restart numbering in Part 2 (1, 2, 3... instead of continuing)
course.bulkAddInstructions: Student Names (one per line or separated by commas):
course.bulkAddPlaceholder:
John Doe
Jane Smith
Alice Johnson

or

John Doe, Jane Smith, Alice Johnson
course.oneStudentRequired: Please enter at least one student name
course.deleteStudentConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this student? This will also delete all their feedback.
course.invalidTaskCount: Please enter a valid number of tasks (1-50)
course.invalidPartTaskCount: Please enter valid number of tasks for each part (1-50)
course.deleteTestConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this test? This will delete all feedback for this test.
course.bulkAddHelpText: Enter names separated by line breaks or commas. Empty lines will be ignored.
course.twoPartHelpText: Enable to configure different sections with different allowed aids
course.taskNumberingHelp: Tasks will be numbered 1, 2, 3... (you can customize later)
course.deleteOralTestConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this oral assessment? This will delete all assessments for this test.
course.oralTestDescriptionPlaceholder: e.g., Focus on understanding derivative rules
course.oralTestTopicsHelp: Comma-separated list of topics to be covered
course.noLabelsYet: No labels yet. Add labels to categorize tasks by theme/skill.
course.labelsHelpText: Labels help you track student performance across themes. Use / to group, e.g. "probability/basics" and "probability/simulation".
course.removeLabelConfirm: Remove label "{label}"? This will not remove it from existing tasks.

test.testSettingsDesc: Configure task structure and general feedback template
test.studentFeedbackDesc: Select a student to provide individual feedback
test.feedbackMarkedComplete: Feedback marked as complete and auto-saved!
test.noCompletedFeedback: No completed feedback to export. Mark at least one student as complete first.
test.exportPDFsConfirm:
Export PDFs for {count} completed student(s)?

This will download multiple files.
test.generalCommentDesc: This comment will appear on all student feedback PDFs
test.commentPlaceholder2: e.g., Excellent! $integral x^2 d x = x^3/3 + C$
test.selectStudentPrompt: Select a student to provide feedback
test.snippetsDesc: Click a snippet to insert it at your cursor position.
test.snippetsClickTextarea: Click on a task comment field to activate snippet insertion.
test.noTasksMatch: No tasks match the selected filters
test.analyticsNote: Note: Avg Score is average points earned across all students who attempted the task. Attempt % is percentage of students who scored 1 or more points.
test.studentAbsent: This student is marked as absent and will not be graded for this test.

oral.title: Oral Assessment
oral.subtitle: LK20-based assessment with 6 dimensions
oral.weightTooltip: Higher weight = more influence on the final score. Default: 1 (equal)
oral.generalObservationsPlaceholder: Overall notes from the oral assessment...

strategy.label: Strategy and Method
strategy.description: What strategy does the student choose? Can the student explain why this approach makes sense?
strategy.rubric2: Chooses a strategy, but it is partially random or not very relevant.
strategy.rubric4: Chooses a relevant strategy, but it is not fully carried out or not entirely precise.
strategy.rubric6: Quickly chooses a precise and relevant strategy, and adjusts as needed along the way.

reasoning.label: Reasoning and Argumentation
reasoning.description: Can the student explain their reasoning, justify results, and assess whether something is valid / makes sense?
reasoning.rubric2: Explains somewhat, but with breaks in logic, gaps, or missing justification.
reasoning.rubric4: Explains thoughts understandably with partial justification, but not full solidity.
reasoning.rubric6: Has a coherent, logical, well-justified mathematical argumentation.

representations.label: Representations
representations.description: How does the student use graphs / algebra / tables / verbal explanation? Can they move between representations?
representations.rubric2: Uses 1 representation, but struggles to use it precisely.
representations.rubric4: Uses multiple representations, but with some inaccuracy in the transitions.
representations.rubric6: Uses relevant representations precisely, and switches between them naturally.

modeling.label: Modeling / Application
modeling.description: Can the student connect the mathematics to the situation / problem and evaluate the model / result?
modeling.rubric2: Connects mathematics somewhat to context, but superficially.
modeling.rubric4: Can explain connection to context, but has limited assessment of validity.
modeling.rubric6: Critically evaluates model / result and shows awareness of limitations and applications.

communication.label: Communication
communication.description: Precision in mathematical language and logical structure in oral explanation.
communication.rubric2: Language is understandable, but with imprecise terms or unclear explanations.
communication.rubric4: Uses mathematical language fairly well, but somewhat unclear structure or logic.
communication.rubric6: Communicates precisely with correct mathematical language and clear structure.

subject_knowledge.label: Subject Knowledge (Content Area)
subject_knowledge.description: To what extent does the student show subject knowledge of the mathematical content area the task deals with? (e.g. powers, logarithms, derivatives, probability…)
subject_knowledge.rubric2: Has simple / fragmented understanding of the relevant content area.
subject_knowledge.rubric4: Has good understanding of the content, but lacks confidence in parts of it.
subject_knowledge.rubric6: Has confident, solid subject understanding and can use the knowledge flexibly.

dashboard.title: Student Dashboard
dashboard.betterNoAids: Student performs better on no aids tasks ({score1}) than all aids tasks ({score2}). This may indicate strong foundational skills.
dashboard.betterAllAids: Student performs better on all aids tasks ({score1}) than no aids tasks ({score2}). Consider focusing on mental calculation and basic skills.
dashboard.equalPerformance: Student performs equally well on both no aids and all aids tasks ({score}).
dashboard.helpAttemptRate: Attempt Rate shows how many tasks the student tries (more than 0 points)
dashboard.helpTheme: Theme Performance shows average scores for different skill areas
dashboard.helpCategory: Category Performance shows average scores by difficulty/type (from national exam guidelines)
dashboard.helpPart: Test Part Performance compares no aids vs all aids performance
dashboard.category1Description: Tasks that require you to demonstrate understanding of concepts and skills.
dashboard.category2Description: Tasks that require you to make connections, apply concepts and use skills in varied ways and different situations.
dashboard.category3Description: Tasks that require some form of exploration or problem-solving. The tasks require you to systematize information, find connections, use varied strategies and demonstrate problem-solving competence.
dashboard.score0: No relevant mathematical approach / no attempt.
dashboard.score1: Little attempt, but without correct elements or relevant strategies.
dashboard.score2: Relevant start or some correct operations. Understanding is fragmented.
dashboard.score3: Choice of reasonable strategy/method, but major errors in understanding / execution.
dashboard.score4: Mostly correct with good understanding, but lacks critical assessment / model evaluation or central parts are not quite right.
dashboard.score5: The task is largely solved correctly with proper reasoning and method. Minor errors in communication or representations do not disturb competence.
dashboard.score6: The task is correctly solved with precise use of concepts, method and representations. The student also evaluates the result / model and whether it is valid in context.

analytics.title: Course Analytics
analytics.performanceAnalysisDesc: Performance analysis by labels and categories
analytics.noStudentDataForLabel: No student data for this label
analytics.clickLabelPrompt: Click on a label to see student performance
analytics.noLabelData: No label data available. Add labels to your course and assign them to tasks to see performance analytics.
analytics.noCategoryData: No category data available. Assign categories (1, 2, 3) to your tasks to see performance analytics.
analytics.categoryGuide: Category Guide: Categories help you group tasks by difficulty or topic. Assign categories when configuring test tasks to track performance patterns.
analytics.analyticsHelp1: Labels help you track performance across themes (e.g., "logarithms", "fractions")
analytics.analyticsHelp2: Categories help you group tasks by difficulty or type (1, 2, 3)
analytics.analyticsHelp3: Click on a label to see individual student performance for that theme
analytics.analyticsHelp4: Green (5-6), Yellow (3.5-4.9), Red (<3.5) indicate performance levels
analytics.classProgressDesc: Average score and % blank from test to test
analytics.testAnalyticsDesc: View detailed task performance for each test

backup.autoBackupDesc: Creates automatic backups every 5 minutes so you never lose data
backup.noBackups: No backups yet. A backup is created automatically every 5 minutes.
backup.createFailed: Failed to create backup. Check browser storage space.
backup.restoreConfirm:
Restore data from {date}?

This will replace all current data with {courses} courses and {feedback} feedback entries.

A backup of your current data is automatically created before restoration.
backup.warningFeedbackCount: WARNING: This course contains {count} completed feedback entries that will be deleted!
backup.autoBackupCreated: A backup is automatically created before deletion so you can undo.
backup.invalidFileFormat: Invalid file format. Select a .json file exported from MathMonitor.
backup.importPreviewDesc: Review the data that will be imported:
backup.modeMerge: Merge with existing (add new students, tests and feedback)
backup.safetyNote: A backup of all current data is automatically created before import.
backup.folderImportDesc: The following courses were found in the selected folder:
backup.folderImportFailed: Failed to read the folder. Check that it contains valid data.
backup.partialErrors: Some items could not be imported

help.title: Help & Guide
help.subtitle: Learn how to use MathMonitor effectively
help.step1Desc: Start by creating a course (e.g., "Math 10A"). Add all students to the course roster. They'll be available for all tests in this course.
help.step2Desc: Create a test within your course. Configure tasks with or without subtasks. Set weights, labels and categories for analytics tracking.
help.step3Desc: Select each student and assign points (0-6) per task. Use keyboard shortcuts for speed. Add comments using Typst math notation and snippets.
help.step4Desc: Mark feedback as complete to save. Preview and download professional PDF documents for each student with one click.
help.step5Desc: Use the analytics page to track class progress over time. View performance by labels, categories, and individual student dashboards.
help.shortcutsDesc: Use keyboard shortcuts on the grading page to grade faster without touching the mouse.
help.shortcutSetPoints: Set points for the active task
help.shortcutEscape: Back to point buttons from comment
help.shortcutsTip: Tip: The shortcuts work in both student grading and task grading mode. You can grade an entire class without using the mouse!
help.studentModeDesc: Select a student in the sidebar and grade all their tasks at once. Best for writing detailed comments and reviewing each student's work holistically.
help.taskModeDesc: Pick a task and grade every student for that task, one at a time. Great for consistency — you compare the same task across the whole class. Switch with the Task Grading button or Alt+T.
help.progressGridDesc: The grading overview shows a student × task heatmap with color-coded cells. Green = high score, amber = mid, red = low, blue = comment only. Click any row to jump to that student.
help.quickGradingDesc: Click one of the 7 point buttons (0–6) to set a score instantly — no dropdown needed.
help.quickGradingExample: In this example, 4 points is selected (purple button)
help.gradingDesc: MathMonitor uses a 0-60 scoring system that is fair, consistent, and easy to understand regardless of the number of tasks.
help.benefit1: Consistent scale regardless of number of tasks
help.benefit2: Always results in whole numbers (no rounding needed)
help.benefit3: Easy to understand and compare across tests
help.dataSafetyDesc: MathMonitor offers several ways to keep your data safe.
help.folderSyncDesc: Connect a folder (e.g. OneDrive) from the home page. All data is saved there automatically and syncs across browsers and devices. Changes are merged intelligently so you never lose work.
help.autoBackupDesc: A rolling backup is created every 5 minutes in your browser. You can also create manual backups, view past backups, and restore from any point.
help.jsonExportDesc: Use 'Export All' to download a full JSON backup of every course. Import it on another machine, or restore after clearing browser data.
help.darkModeDesc: Toggle dark mode with the sun/moon icon in the navbar. Your preference is auto-detected from system settings and saved across sessions.
help.taskConfigDesc: Configure each task in the test settings panel before you start grading.
help.weightDesc: Assign a custom weight (1, 2, 3…) to tasks that should count more toward the total score. Tasks default to equal weight.
help.labelsDesc: Tag tasks with theme labels like "probability/basics". Use / to create parent/child groups. Labels power the analytics dashboards.
help.absentDesc: Mark a student as absent for a test using the person icon. Absent students are excluded from analytics, heatmap, PDF export, and Excel export.
help.twoPartDesc: Enable two-part mode to split a test into Part 1 (no aids) and Part 2 (all aids). Analytics compare performance between parts.
help.pdfExportDesc: Generate individual PDF feedback documents using Typst. Preview before downloading. You can export one student or all completed students at once.
help.csvExportDesc: Download all course data as a CSV file from the course page. Opens directly in Excel with student scores, task analysis, point distributions, and all comments.
help.exportContent1Desc: All students with scores for each test, averages, and completion rate
help.exportContent2Desc: For each test: date, description, general comment, student statistics
help.exportContent3Desc: Average score per task, attempt percentage, point distribution (0-6)
help.exportContent4Desc: General comments, task comments, and individual comments for each student
help.typstDesc: Use Typst syntax to write mathematical expressions in all comment fields. Math is enclosed in $ symbols.
help.snippetsDesc: Snippets help you reuse common feedback comments. Save time and maintain consistency.
help.snippetStep1: Click the snippet panel toggle button in the toolbar
help.snippetStep2: Browse by category or view all snippets
help.snippetStep3: Click a snippet to insert at cursor position
help.createSnippetsDesc: Click 'Create new snippet' at the bottom of the snippet picker to add your own frequently-used comments.
help.labelPerformanceDesc: Track student performance across themes like "logarithms", "fractions", or "algebra". Assign labels to tasks during test configuration.
help.categoryPerformanceDesc: Group tasks by difficulty (1=Easy, 2=Medium, 3=Hard) or by type. Compare performance patterns across categories.
help.classProgressDesc: A dual-axis chart on the analytics page shows how the class average score and % blank answers change from test to test.
help.studentDashboardDesc: View individual student progress across all tests with trend arrows. See performance by labels, categories, and test parts.
help.oralDesc: Create oral assessments for face-to-face evaluations using the LK20 framework. Grade students across 6 dimensions with rubric guidance at each level.
help.oralScoring: Each dimension is scored 0–6. The average across all dimensions is multiplied by 10 to produce a 0–60 score, consistent with written tests.
help.tip1Desc: Connect a folder (e.g. OneDrive) right away so your data syncs automatically and survives browser changes.
help.tip2Desc: Name courses clearly (e.g., "Math 10A - Fall 2024") for easy identification and organization.
help.tip3Desc: Complete your course roster before creating tests. Students automatically appear in all tests.
help.tip4Desc: Press 0-6 to set points, Tab to move between tasks, and Alt+arrows to switch students. It's much faster than clicking.
help.tip5Desc: Label tasks with hierarchical themes (e.g. "algebra/equations") and categories for powerful analytics.
help.tip6Desc: Use the 'Export All' button regularly to create JSON backups of all your course data.
help.contactInfo: For additional support or to report issues, check the GitHub repository or contact your administrator.
help.author: Torodd F. Ottestad - lektorodd.no

sync.connectHint: Connect a folder from the courses page to keep your data safe across browsers and devices.
